FAQs

Q: Is J’accuse! based on a true story?

A: Yes, J’accuse! is based on the infamous Dreyfus Affair that took place in France in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. The film depicts the events surrounding the wrongful conviction of Alfred Dreyfus, a French-Jewish officer in the French army.

Q: Who directed J’accuse!?

A: J’accuse! was directed by renowned filmmaker Roman Polanski. He is known for his exceptional storytelling and has received numerous accolades throughout his career.

Q: What is the significance of the film’s title, J’accuse!?

A: The title of the film, J’accuse!, is inspired by the famous open letter written by Émile Zola in 1898, in which he accused the French government of anti-Semitism and a miscarriage of justice in the Dreyfus Affair. The film pays homage to Zola’s courageous act of speaking out against injustice.

Q: Who are the main actors in J’accuse!?

A: The lead roles in J’accuse! are portrayed by Jean Dujardin, who plays Colonel Georges Picquart, and Louis Garrel, who plays Captain Alfred Dreyfus. Both actors deliver extraordinary performances that bring their characters to life.
